abstract.p: Compaq Computer Corp names FCB Worldwide to handle its worldwide advertising account; account had been handled by DDB Worldwide (M)

block.p: The Compaq Computer Corporation named FCB Worldwide in New York, part of True North Communications, to handle its worldwide advertising account. Billings were estimated at $300 million. The account had been handled by DDB Worldwide in New York, part of the Omnicom Group.
The decision came after a three-month review that had been narrowed to FCB, DDB and one other agency in New York, Saatchi & Saatchi.

The Compaq Computer Corporation named FCB Worldwide in New York, part of True North Communications, to handle its worldwide advertising account. Billings were estimated at $300 million. The account had been handled by DDB Worldwide in New York, part of the Omnicom Group.
The decision came after a three-month review that had been narrowed to FCB, DDB and one other agency in New York, Saatchi & Saatchi.
Assignments for direct marketing and promotions, primarily in the United States, remain at the New York office of Draft Worldwide, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies.

Compaq consolidated its advertising at DDB in June 1998 after acquiring a DDB client, the Digital Equipment Corporation. That was unexpected because, until then, Compaq's advertising had been handled by Ammirati Puris Lintas in New York, now part of the Lowe Lintas & Partners unit of the Lowe Group, owned by Interpublic. There have been several changes in top management at Compaq since DDB's selection.
